Population-level Summary.name: Population-level Summary

definition.text: Population level summary for the clinical endpoint of interest, which provides a basis for comparison between treatment conditions.

Population-level Summary.guidance: Description of the population-level summary (e.g., mean difference, relative risk)
Population-level Summary.conformance: Conditional: If there is a population-level summary as estimand

business_rules.relationship: Row Heading; Description

Population-level Summary.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered primary objective

Population 2.name: Population 2

definition.text: The population of patients targeted by the clinical question. This will be represented by the entire trial population, a subgroup defined by a particular characteristic measured at baseline, or a principal stratum defined by the occurrence (or non-occurrence, depending on context) of a specific intercurrent event.

Population 2.guidance: List of key characteristics, such as demographic characteristics (e.g. age, sex) and clinical characteristics (e.g. prior therapies, symptoms, severity, biomarker status)
Population 2.conformance: Conditional: If there is a population for Secondary
Population 2.cardinality: One to Row Heading; One to Secondary Objective Table; Secondary Objective <#>; Protocol Identifier

business_rules.relationship: Row Heading, Description; Estimand Characteristic

Population 2.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Treatment 2.name: Treatment 2

definition.text: The treatment condition of interest and, as appropriate, the alternative treatment condition to which comparison will be made (referred to as “treatment” through the remainder of this document). These might be individual interventions, combinations of interventions administered concurrently, e.g. as add-on to standard of care, or might consist of an overall regimen involving a complex sequence of interventions.

Treatment 2.guidance: List of key aspects of treatment regimens in each study group, including at least investigational agents, dosage, and administration route
Treatment 2.conformance: Conditional: If there is a population for Secondary
Treatment 2.cardinality: One to Row Heading, One to Secondary Objective Table, Project Identifier

business_rules.relationship: Row Heading, Description; Estimand Characteristics

Treatment 2.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Endpoint 2.name: Endpoint 2

definition.text: The variable to be obtained for each patient that is required to address the clinical question. The specification of the variable might include whether the patient experiences an intercurrent event

Endpoint 2.cardinality: One to Row Heading, One to Secondary Objective Table, Project Identifier

business_rules.relationship: Row Heading; Description; Table Estimand Characteristics; Secondary (1…n) Estimand

Endpoint 2.repeating: Yes, repeatable for each numbered secondary objective.

Informed consent for Use of Remaining Sa.name: Informed consent for Use of Remaining Samples in Exploratory Research

definition.text: A description of the consent requirements for exploratory research using the remainder of mandatory samples. If applicable, this may include text in the original consent that address the use of remaining samples or additional text.

Informed consent for Use of Remaining Sa.guidance:
If participants will be asked to consent to optional exploratory research using the remainder of mandatory samples, describe the use of remaining samples for optional exploratory research.
If any exploratory research is planned and additional written consent regarding the use of remaining samples for exploratory research will be obtained, describe the consent process.

business_rules.relationship: 11.3.2 Informed Consent for Use of Remaining Samples in Exploratory Research

Country-Region-specific Protocol Clarifi.name: Country-Region-specific Protocol Clarification

definition.text: A description of any country or region-specific clarifications related to a protocol item.

Country-Region-specific Protocol Clarifi.guidance:
Although global clinical trial practices are increasingly harmonised, some country/region-specific differences in requirements do exist (e.g., document retention periods, contraception requirements). Where differences in requirements cannot be reconciled, sponsors should explain how they will document and communicate country/region-specific differences (e.g., by country/region-specific amendments or addenda).
An alternative to country/region-specific amendments is to list the specific differences by country or countries in this section, including a reference to the relevant section of the protocol where the differing requirement applies.
If not applicable, retain the heading and enter “Not applicable.”
Country-Region-specific Protocol Clarifi.conformance: Optional if there is Country/Region-specific differences

business_rules.relationship: Country /Region Identifier; 12.2 Country/Region-Specific Differences

amendment Identifier.name: amendment Identifier

definition.text: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify a protocol amendment.

amendment Identifier.guidance: Move the Overview of Changes table from the previous amendments to this section in reverse chronological order (most recent first).

business_rules.relationship: Overview of Changes from each prior protocol amendment is {provided below} or <specify alternative location>}.

amendment Identifier.repeating: Yes, repeatable one table per amendment identifier

Previous Amendment Date.guidance: Move the Overview of Changes table from the previous amendments to this section in reverse chronological order (most recent first).

business_rules.relationship: {The Overview of Changes from each prior protocol amendment is {provided below} or <specify alternative location>}.

Previous Amendment Date.repeating: Yes, repeatable one table per amendment
